Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the system log each line has a timestamp an action type like FOCUS TYPING SAVE etc and some attributes such as the application name and window title The goal is to convert these lowlevel actions into meaningful activities and group them into cases

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: From the log it seems like the user is working on multiple documents and tasks For example theres Document1docx QuarterlyReportdocx an email about the annual meeting and ReportDraftpdf and Budget2024xlsx Each of these could represent a separate case but I need to see how the user interacts with them over time

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Maybe each document or task is a separate case Case 1 Working on Document1docx Case 2 Handling the email about the annual meeting Case 3 Reviewing ReportDraftpdf Case 4 Updating Budget2024xlsx Case 5 Working on QuarterlyReportdocx

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Perhaps the cases are the individual documents or tasks For example Case Document1docx Activities Focus Typing Save etc Case Email about Annual Meeting Activities Click to open scroll reply send etc

Name: Validation - PE
Text: In process mining the events for a case dont have to be consecutive in the log they just need to be ordered by timestamp within the case So we can group all events related to Document1docx into one case all events related to the email into another case and so on

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: For QuarterlyReportdocx the first event is at 085950 FOCUS then next is at 090715 FOCUS over 7 minutes later Maybe the Resume Document at 090715 is not necessary and we can assume that the typing at 090745 is a continuation of the work started at 085950 But theres a FOCUS event at 090715 which indicates the user switched back to the document

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: To keep activity names consistent and meaningful for process mining perhaps its better to have For any document Word Excel PDF etc First interaction FOCUS or SCROLL if no FOCUS Start Document Subsequent interactions based on the action eg Edit Content Review Document etc
